metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20568 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In (TBD) of (TBD), there is a possible way to corrupt kernel memory due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-220738351References: Upstream kernel

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> Appears to only affect the upstream stable 5.10 kernel
